Sentencas: We address the issue of achieving high oxide ion conductivity at low temperatures (<= 500 degrees C) in stable electrolytes for solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) techonology.
Titulo: High oxide ion conductivity below 500 °C in the garnets LaxY3-xFe5O12+δ

Sentencas: We report here a high oxide ion conductivity (similar to 10(-2)
Titulo: High oxide ion conductivity below 500 °C in the garnets LaxY3-xFe5O12+δ

Sentencas: S cm(-1)) in the La substituted yttrium iron garnets LaxY3-xFe5O12+delta at low temperatures (similar to 450 degrees C).
Titulo: High oxide ion conductivity below 500 °C in the garnets LaxY3-xFe5O12+δ

Sentencas: The judicious substitution of high electropositive La3+ ions in the yttrium iron garnet (x <= 0.45) affords continuous and easy oxide ion conduction pathways through polyhedral networks even at a low temperature of similar to 127 degrees C.
Titulo: High oxide ion conductivity below 500 °C in the garnets LaxY3-xFe5O12+δ

Sentencas: The conduction pathways have been visualized from the maximum entropy method analyzed soft bond valence sum distribution, obtained from neutron diffraction data.
Titulo: High oxide ion conductivity below 500 °C in the garnets LaxY3-xFe5O12+δ

Sentencas: Our study also shows that these iron garnets have high structural stability over a broad range of temperature (at least over 27-800 degrees C), and compatible thermal expansion coefficient (similar to 10.6 x 10(-6) degrees C-1) with that of the commonly used interconnect and electrode SOFC materials.
Titulo: High oxide ion conductivity below 500 °C in the garnets LaxY3-xFe5O12+δ

Sentencas: We reveal that the oxide ion conduction in the present garnet is based on an excess oxide ion concentration mechanism.
Titulo: High oxide ion conductivity below 500 °C in the garnets LaxY3-xFe5O12+δ

Sentencas: The observed high oxide-ion conductivity at low temperatures in the present trivalent substituted garnets is a remarkable finding for the development of an efficient SOFC technology.
Titulo: High oxide ion conductivity below 500 °C in the garnets LaxY3-xFe5O12+δ
